title: Part A (i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that substance L most likely crosses the membrane by active transport but instead refers to some other form of transport, such as passive transport.
The response indicates that substance L most likely crosses the membrane by active transport.

title: Part A (ii)

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The sketched curve meets none of the criteria below.
The sketched curve meets only one of the criteria below.
The sketched curve meets only two of the criteria below.
The sketched curve meets all of the criteria below.

title: Part C (i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

title: Part D (i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that substance L will be unable to enter the cells if it is attached to a large protein OR does not indicate that substance L will be unable to enter the cells if it is attached to a large protein unless there is a specific cell membrane receptor for the protein.

The response indicates that substance L will be unable to enter the cells if it is attached to a large protein OR the response indicates that substance L will be unable to enter the cells if it is attached to a large protein unless there is a specific cell membrane receptor for the protein.
